fields.headline: Clinton courts African American vote
fields.bodyText: With primary voting in southern states just around the corner, Hillary Clinton gave a speech on “systemic racism” on Tuesday and visited Al Sharpton, the activist and organizer, and the National Urban League. Video: Hillary Clinton meets Al Sharpton Clinton’s rival Bernie Sanders had breakfast last week with Sharpton, who has so far withheld his endorsement in the Democratic race. Thomas Piketty on the rise of Bernie Sanders Sanders was joined at a rally in South Carolina on Tuesday by Erica Garner, daughter of Eric Garner, a New Yorker who died after being placed in a chokehold by police. The booing and jeering rained on Donald Trump at last Saturday’s debate appear to have represented … nothing, as Trump retained a huge lead in a post-debate poll. Who are Trump’s backers? Some 38% told the pollster they wish the south had won the civil war, 80% support Trump’s ban-Muslims idea and 31% supported a ban on gay people. In a radio interview, Trump did not shoot down paranoiac theorizing about foul play in the death at the weekend of supreme court justice Antonin Scalia. “They say they found the pillow on his face, which is a pretty unusual place to find a pillow,” Trump said. It later came out that Scalia died with a pillow behind his head – not on his face. The late justice was to lie in repose at the court Friday before a funeral on Saturday at the national basilica in Washington DC. A Marco Rubio video ad recasting a classic Ronald Reagan “Morning in America” spot opens with a panning shot of scenic … Vancouver, Canada. Rubio released a video highlighting his plum endorsement from South Carolina congressman Trey Gowdy, the chairman of the Benghazi inquisition panel. After a poll found Jeb Bush tied for fifth in South Carolina, he said: “I think we’ll do better than fifth here ... I’m in it for the long haul.” Barbara Bush was to hit the trail to help.
